text:
When a Class-Path attribute value is longer than one line the addContinuation 
operation inserts a space and a return to the classpath value. This makes the 
classpath unusable.

Sorry if this is redundant. I did a query using Manifest in the summary line 
and didn't get any hits.

text:
Ant's <manifest> task splits lines exactly according to the relevant specs; we
do get faulted for breaking lines sporadically, but ant is compliant. Which
means whoever wrote your manifest reader code probably didnt read the spec
fully, or maybe they are working on a different version. 

Is it a particular java version that is misbehaving, or a funny platform like a
cellphone/PDA?
creator: stevel@apache.org
